message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including fever, chest pain exacerbated by deep inspiration, and crackles in both lung bases suggest a potential viral myocarditis. Among the options, only Picornavirus is known to cause viral myocarditis. The scratchy sound best heard along the left sternal border suggests pericarditis as a complication.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and presentation suggest myocarditis, and among the options, Picornavirus is the most common cause of viral myocarditis. Togavirus can cause rubella which has a mild presentation, paramyxovirus can cause measles or mumps, and orthomyxovirus can cause influenza which has a negative rapid influenza test.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, especially the chest pain exacerbated by deep inspiration, suggest pericarditis. Diffuse ST-elevations with depressed PR interval on EKG is a classic finding for pericarditis. Among the options, Picornavirus is most likely to cause pericarditis. Togaviruses cause diseases such as chikungunya fever, paramyxoviruses cause diseases such as mumps, and orthomyxoviruses cause influenza.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms presented suggest acute pericarditis or myocarditis. Among the listed virus options, only Picornavirus is known to cause acute pericarditis and myocarditis.
